final_poem:
Underneath the starlit sky so wide,
The world in silence gently rides.
A moon, both guide and ghostly light,
Whispers tales through silent night.

Leaves rustle soft beneath the breeze,
Hushed voices from a distant tease.
Fireflies dance with gentle glee,
In this realm of shadows set free.

Night holds secrets in its embrace,
Of dreams that whisper as we chase
Our deepest fears, our fondest hopes—
In darkness cradles all our thoughts.
